triples.name: Neural network (machine learning)
triples.relevance: Neural networks are used to approximate the unknown nonlinear functions of multiagent systems.

triples.name: Adaptive control
triples.relevance: The paper proposes an adaptive neural finite-time event-triggered control scheme for nonlinear multiagent systems.

triples.name: Consensus dynamics
triples.relevance: Consensus tracking is a fundamental problem being solved for multiagent systems in this paper.

triples.name: Backstepping
triples.relevance: Backstepping technique is used in the distributed control scheme to circumvent explosion of complexity and singularity issues.

triples.name: Directed graph
triples.relevance: Directed graphs represent the topology of communication networks in the multiagent system.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Nonlinear multiagent systems are the primary subject and application domain of the control scheme.

triples.name: Event-driven programming
triples.relevance: Event-triggered mechanisms with dynamic thresholds are proposed to reduce network resource waste.

triples.name: Lyapunov stability
triples.relevance: Finite-time stability analysis is conducted using novel stability criteria, building on Lyapunov stability theory.
